citations.narrative:
Not all dogs had official identification listed on APHIS 7005 Adult Dogs on Hand and/or on dogs by either tag or microchip.
Official identification is required to help manage and track husbandry records and treatments for each dog. Ensure that
each dog has their official identification recorded on the adult dog list (APHIS 7005) and that each dog is wearing their
official identification number as required.
***Correct by May 8, 2023.

Three enclosures had water containers that were empty. The licensee reported watering chores were completed in the
morning. The time of inspection was right before normal afternoon chore time which would include filling and refreshing
water containers. When dogs were brought water they all drank water in a manner suggesting they were moderately
thirsty. Empty water containers do not ensure dogs have adequate drinking water and adequate water is necessary for
dogs to stay healthy. Potable water must be continuously available for dogs, unless restricted by the attending
veterinarian. For their health, ensure that water containers are checked and filled often enough to ensure dogs have
drinking water available at all times.
***Correct from this day forward.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The doors between the indoor/outdoor areas for dogs had a build-up of brown material on them. A build-up of brownish
material could spread sickness in the building. The indoor surfaces that dogs contact need to be cleaned and sanitized
often enough to prevent a buildup of material. Ensure to include the door surfaces in the cleaning and sanitizing routine
and ensure they are cleaned and sanitized at least once every 2 weeks or more often if needed to prevent a build-up of
material.
***Correct by 3/14/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
2.51 
   
Form of official tag. 
Not all dogs had official identification listed on APHIS 7005 Adult Dogs on Hand and/or on dogs by either tag or microchip.  
Official identification is required to help manage and track husbandry records and treatments for each dog.  Ensure that 
each dog has their official identification recorded on the adult dog list (APHIS 7005) and that each dog is wearing their 
official identification number as required.  
***Correct by May 8, 2023. 
3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
Three enclosures had water containers that were empty.  The licensee reported watering chores were completed in the 
morning.  The time of inspection was right before normal afternoon chore time which would include filling and refreshing 
water containers.  When dogs were brought water they all drank water in a manner suggesting they were moderately 
thirsty.  Empty water containers do not ensure dogs have adequate drinking water and adequate water is necessary for 
dogs to stay healthy.  Potable water must be continuously available for dogs, unless restricted by the attending 
veterinarian.  For their health, ensure that water containers  are checked and filled often enough to ensure dogs have

drinking water available at all times.  
***Correct from this day forward. 
3.11(b)(2) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The doors between the indoor/outdoor areas for dogs had a build-up of brown material on them.  A build-up of brownish 
material could spread sickness in the building. The indoor surfaces that dogs contact need to be cleaned and sanitized 
often enough to prevent a buildup of material.  Ensure to include the door surfaces in the cleaning and sanitizing routine 
and ensure they are cleaned and sanitized at least once every 2 weeks or more often if needed to prevent a build-up of 
material.  
***Correct by 3/14/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
